Test.Comment: Test on error -25317.

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_errorminus25317 (a CHAR(10), b CHAR(10))
DATALOAD TABLE load_errorminus25317 A 1 B 2 INFILE '<infile_path>load_errorminus25317.data'

Error.ErrorMessage: Constant must be compatible with column type and length (column: 'A').

Test.Comment: Test file format options syntactically: - codeset not available as option - only possible codetypes are UCS2, UTF8 and ASCII - only possible format specifications in case of data streams are FORMATTED, COMPRESSED, PAGES, RECORDS

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE load_test1 INSTREAM FILE 'test.data' codeset ISO8859-1

Error.ErrorMessage: Syntax error

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE load_test1 INSTREAM FILE 'test.data' some_name

Error.ErrorMessage: Syntax error

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE load_test1 A 1 B 2 INSTREAM FILE 'test.data' COMPRESS

Error.ErrorMessage: Syntax error

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE load_test1 A 1- 10 B 11 - 20 INSTREAM FILE 'test.data' FORMATT

Error.ErrorMessage: Some column descriptions with end position but file format is COMPRESSED.

Test.Comment: Check for table constraints during Load

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE room (HNO Fixed (4,0) NOT NULL, TYPE Char (6) NOT NULL, FREE Fixed (3,0), PRICE Fixed (6,2), PRIMARY KEY (HNO, TYPE))
DATALOAD TABLE room IF POS 16-24 < '200,00' AND POS 06-11 = 'double' hno 01-05 type 06-11 free 12-15 price 16-24 INFILE '<infile_path>room.data' FORMATTED
DATALOAD TABLE room IF POS 06-11 = 'suite' OR POS 06-11 = 'double' hno 01-05 type 06-11 free 12-15 price 16-24 INFILE '<infile_path>room.data' FORMATTED

Test.Comment: Test external column data types syntactically: 1. INTEGER requires file format FORMATTED; no need to create the table nor to have the data file 2. INTEGER requires 2 or 4 Byte long fields

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE load_test5 A 1 INTEGER B 2 INFILE 'load_test5.data'

Error.ErrorMessage: File option FORMATTED required.

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE load_test5 A 1-3 INTEGER B 4-8 INFILE 'load_test5.data' FORMATTED

Error.ErrorMessage: Column "A" - INTEGER field: 1, 2 or 4 bytes long, (double if HEX).

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE load_test5 A 1-5 INTEGER B 6-10 INFILE 'load_test5.data' FORMATTED

Error.ErrorMessage: Column "A" - INTEGER field: 1, 2 or 4 bytes long, (double if HEX).

DATALOAD TABLE load_test6 A 1-4 INTEGER B 5-8 INTEGER INFILE '<infile_path>load_test6_2.bindata' FORMATTED INTEGER LOHI

DATALOAD TABLE load_test7 A 1-4 INTEGER B 5-9 C 10-45 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test7.bindata' FORMATTED INTEGER LOHI START 1 3
DATALOAD TABLE load_test7 A 1-4 INTEGER B 5-9 C 10-45 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test7.bindata' FORMATTED INTEGER LOHI START 4 MAXROWS

Test.Comment: Test loading into DB data type CHAR BYTE

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test15 (a CHAR(10) BYTE, b CHAR(10), c CHAR(10))
DATALOAD TABLE load_test15 A 1 B 2 C 3 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test15.data'

Test.Comment:
Test loading into DB data type CHAR BYTE
Load CHAR BYTE into a table with a CHAR BYTE column. This single column is primary key column, too. This means it is variable long (saved in DB page). All values are filled up to the define length of that column. Thus they must be trimmed during load. At DATALOAD the values are trimmed by the kernel during insertion. At FASTLOAD the Loader must trim the values during insertion.

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test16 (a CHAR(10) BYTE primary key)
SELECT A from load_test16 WHERE A BETWEEN x'7465737431' and x'746573743130'
SELECT A from load_test16 WHERE A = x'746573743130'

Test.Comment: Test loading into DB data type CHAR BYTE: expected error because of wrong value in data file

Test.Comment: Test loading into a table the user is not owner of but has all rights granted on. Can't be executed as there is still an error in kernel when executing SAVE CATALOG OF <table name> command on a table the user is not the owner but has only ALL rights granted on: -5001 POS(29) Missing privilege:LOAD_TEST33'

Statement.CallString: CREATE USER notowner password initial resource not exclusive
CREATE TABLE load_test33 (a CHAR(10), b CHAR(5))
grant all on load_test33 to LOADER

Test.Comment: Load data into table with a single mandatory column (NOT NULL). 1. Step: Data for mandatory column is not given while it is specified in the command. Loader must stop on error. 2. Step: Same as 1st step but MAXERRORCOUNT is raised. Loader must stop on error different from 1st step error. 3. Step: Data for mandatory column is not specified in the command. Loader must stop on error.

DATALOAD TABLE load_test57 B 1 C 2 A 3 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test57.data'

DATALOAD TABLE load_test57 B 1 C 2 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test57.data'

Test.Comment: Load data into empty table where some records are too long. Various steps that define different MAXERRORCOUNT values 1. Step: 3rd record does not fit. 2. Step: 3rd and 4th records do not fit. 3. Step: 3rd, 4th and 5th records do not fit. Actually in 3rd step 7 records shall be loaded where 3 have invalid data. The first 2 records must be loaded but aren't (see fastload test 59)

DATALOAD TABLE load_test153 A 1 DEFAULT NULL B 2 C 3 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test153.data'

Test.Comment: PTS 1138384 Semantic change in NULL value processing - NULL value specification: '-?-' - no columns specified in command and thus no DEFAULT NULL specification given - NULL value specs found in data file must correctly be processed and inserted as NULL values

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test154 (a CHAR(10), b FIXED(10,5), c FIXED(10,0))

Test.Comment: Load command contains USERGROUP assignment for one of the fields. The field to load with USERGROUP is 32 char long.

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test171 (a CHAR(10), b FIXED(10,5), c FIXED(10,0), benutzergruppe CHAR(32))
DATALOAD TABLE load_test171 benutzergruppe USERGROUP A 1 B 2 C 3 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test164.data'

Test.Comment: Test loading USERGROUP assignment into column of 17 character length. Loyder must stop on error.

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test172 (a CHAR(10), b FIXED(10,5), c FIXED(10,0), benutzergruppe CHAR(17))
DATALOAD TABLE load_test172 A 1 B 2 C 3 BENUTZERGRUPPE USERGROUP INFILE '<infile_path>load_test161.data'

Error.ErrorMessage: SQL error -8004 = Constant must be compatible with column type and length (error position: 81)

Test.Comment: Test loading without column specification

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test173 (a CHAR(10), b FIXED(10,5), c FIXED(10,0), d CHAR(5))

Test.Comment: Load time into a char type column. Load command contains TIME assignment for one of the fields.

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test174(a CHAR(20), b CHAR(10), c CHAR(10))
DATALOAD TABLE load_test174 A TIME B 2 C 3 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test174.data'

Test.Comment: Test assignment of sequence numbers to a certain column

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test175 (a char(10), b integer, c smallint)
DATALOAD TABLE load_test175 A 1 B SEQNO 1000 1 C SEQNO 1 2 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test175.data'
DATALOAD TABLE load_test175 A 1 B SEQNO -1000 1 C SEQNO 4 -2 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test175.data'
DATALOAD TABLE load_test175 A 1 B SEQNO -1000 -10000 C SEQNO 4 100 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test175.data'
DATALOAD TABLE load_test175 A 1 B SEQNO abc 10 C SEQNO 4 2 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test175.data'

Error.ErrorMessage: SQL error -4005 = Unknown column name:ABC (error position: 47)

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE load_test175 A 1 B SEQNO 1 abc C SEQNO 4 2 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test175.data'

Error.ErrorMessage: Specified value C is not a valid integer

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE load_test175 A 1 B SEQNO 1 1 C SEQNO 1000000000 1 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test175.data'

Error.ErrorMessage: This value is not a valid number: 1000000000

Test.Comment: Test assignment of sequence numbers to a certain column where the column might be the first, the last or in the middle

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test176 (a char(10), b integer, c smallint, d char(10))
DATALOAD TABLE load_test176 A 1 B SEQNO 1000 1 C SEQNO 1 2 D 2 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test176.data'
DATALOAD TABLE load_test176 B SEQNO -1000 1 C SEQNO 4 -2 A 1 D 2 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test176.data'
DATALOAD TABLE load_test176 B SEQNO -1000 -10000 A 1 C SEQNO 4 100 D 2 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test176.data'

Test.Comment: Test assignment of sequence numbers to a certain column where the column might be the first, the last or in the middle Column positions are specified absolutely.

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test177 (a char(10), b integer, c smallint, d char(10))
DATALOAD TABLE load_test177 A 2-8 B SEQNO 1000 1 C SEQNO 1 2 D 11-17 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test176.data' formatted
DATALOAD TABLE load_test177 B SEQNO -1000 1 C SEQNO 4 -2 A 2-8 D 11-17 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test176.data' formatted
DATALOAD TABLE load_test177 B SEQNO -1000 -10000 A 2-8 C SEQNO 4 100 D 11-17 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test176.data' formatted

Test.Comment: Test INSTREAM specification DECIMAL 1. DATALOAD-Kommando: das Tausendertrennzeichen ist der Defaultwert (= nichts) und als Dezimalpunkt wird ein vom Default abweichender Wert gewaehlt - ein Komma 2. DATALOAD-Kommando: Tausendertrennzeichen (= Komma) <> Defaultwert; Dezimalpunkt = Default

Statement.CallString: create table LOAD_TEST200 (A FIXED(10,5), B FIXED(10,0))
DATALOAD TABLE LOAD_TEST200 A 1 B 2 INSTREAM FILE '<infile_path>load_test200.data' DECIMAL '//,/'
DATALOAD TABLE load_test200 A 1 B 2 INSTREAM FILE '<infile_path>load_test200_2.data' DECIMAL '/,//'

Test.Comment: Test INSTREAM specification DECIMAL 1. DATALOAD-Kommando: Tausendertrennzeichen (= Komma) <> Defaultwert; Dezimalpunkt (= Punkt) <> Defaultwert 2. DATALOAD-Kommando: Tausendertrennzeichen (= Komma) <> Defaultwert; Dezimalpunkt = Default

Statement.CallString: create table LOAD_TEST202 (A CHAR(10), B FIXED(10,5), C FIXED(10,0))
DATALOAD TABLE LOAD_TEST202 A 1 B 2 C 3 INSTREAM FILE '<infile_path>load_test202.data' DECIMAL '/,/./'
DATALOAD TABLE load_test202 A 1 B 2 C 3 INSTREAM FILE '<infile_path>load_test202.data' DECIMAL '/./,/'

Error.ErrorMessage: This value is not a valid number: 12,345.67880

Test.Comment: Laden eines langen Nummernwertes in eine Tabelle mit einem Schlüssel

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test203 (a DECIMAL (30,5), b DECIMAL (30,5), primary key(a))
DATALOAD TABLE load_test203 A 1 B 2 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test203.data'

Test.Comment: Check Separator and delimiter specifications First 3 statement must generate errors. Thus real files are not necessary.

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE load_test204 A 1 B 2 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test204' DELIMITER '$%$'
DATALOAD TABLE load_test204 A 1 B 2 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test204' SEPARATOR '$%$'

Error.ErrorMessage: Wrong separator/delimiter specification.

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE load_test204 A 1 B 2 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test204' SEPARATOR "|" DELIMITER "|"

Error.ErrorMessage: Syntax error at position 141 (Unexpected token: "|"); check for typing errors

Test.Comment: Check functionality for DELIMITER and SEPARATOR specification All single tests check for delimiters/separators that are not default values. Additionally the data contain those delimiters/separators.

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test205 (A CHAR(10), B INTEGER, C BOOLEAN, D CHAR(20))
DATALOAD TABLE load_test205 A 1 B 2 C 3 D 4 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test205.data' SEPARATOR '/' DELIMITER '*' START 1 5
DATALOAD TABLE load_test205 A 1 B 2 C 3 D 4 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test205.data' DELIMITER '' START 6 5
DATALOAD TABLE load_test205 A 1 B 2 C 3 D 4 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test205.data' DELIMITER '-' START 11 5
DATALOAD TABLE load_test205 A 1 B 2 C 3 D 4 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test205.data' SEPARATOR '|' START 16 5

Test.Comment: Check functionality for DELIMITER and SEPARATOR specification The data consists of a single field; Loader must make sure to remove all leading and/or trailing blanks
Check various possibilities to specify table names in Loader commands

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE LOADER . LOAD_TEST207 A 1 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test207.data'

Test.Comment: Check functionality for DELIMITER and SEPARATOR specification The data contains the separator

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test208 (a CHAR(10), b CHAR(10))
DATALOAD TABLE load_test208 A 1 B 2 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test208.data'

Test.Comment: Check various possibilities to specify table names in Loader commands
Check various possibilities to specify table names in Loader commands
Check various possibilities to specify table names in Loader commands
Check various possibilities to specify table names in Loader commands

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE LOADER . load#_test212 A 1 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test207.data'

Test.Comment: test absolute position definitions in various ways

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test220(A char(10), B int)
DATALOAD TABLE load_test220 A 1-10 B 11-15 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test220.data' FORMATTED
DATALOAD TABLE load_test220 A 1 -10 B 11 -15 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test220.data' FORMATTED
DATALOAD TABLE load_test220 A 1- 10 B 11- 15 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test220.data' FORMATTED
DATALOAD TABLE load_test220 A 1 - 10 B 11 - 15 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test220.data' FORMATTED

Test.Comment: Test position specification and file formats syntactically In most cases the data file does not need to exist because the errors should be caught already by the Loader parser

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test221 (a CHAR(10), b CHAR(10))
DATALOAD TABLE load_test221 A 1-10 B 11-8 infile '<infile_path>load_test221.data' FORMATTED

Error.ErrorMessage: End position for column B lower than start position.

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE load_test221 A 1-10 B 11-20 infile '<infile_path>load_test221.data'

Error.ErrorMessage: Some column descriptions with end position but file format is COMPRESSED.

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE load_test221 A 1 B C 3 infile '<infile_path>load_test221.data'

Error.ErrorMessage: Syntax error at position 35 (Unexpected token: "C").

Statement.CallString: DATALOAD TABLE load_test221 A 1-10 B C 21-30 infile '<infile_path>load_test221.data' FORMATTED

Error.ErrorMessage: Specified value C is not a valid integer

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test222 (a CHAR(10), b CHAR(10), c CHAR(10))
DATALOAD TABLE load_test222 A 3 B 3 C 3 infile '<infile_path>load_test222.data'
DATALOAD TABLE load_test222 A 2 B 2 C 3 infile '<infile_path>load_test222.data'
DATALOAD TABLE load_test222 A 2 B 3 C 3 infile '<infile_path>load_test222.data'

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test223 (a CHAR(10), b CHAR(10), c CHAR(10))
DATALOAD TABLE load_test223 A 11-20 B 11-20 C 21-27 infile '<infile_path>load_test223.data' FORMATTED
DATALOAD TABLE load_test223 A 11-20 B 2-8 C 21-27 infile '<infile_path>load_test223.data' FORMATTED

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test224 (a CHAR(10), b CHAR(5), c CHAR(5))

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test250 (a CHAR(5), b CHAR(5))

Test.Comment: Load complete data of the table load_test51 into table load_test251 in format RECORDS; the test extracts the data itself

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test251 (a CHAR(10), b CHAR(10), c CHAR(10), PRIMARY KEY(a))
DATAEXTRACT FOR DATALOAD TABLE load_test51 outfile '<infile_path>load_test251_generated.catalog' outfile '<infile_path>load_test251_generated.data' RECORDS

Test.Comment: Load data of 2 columns of the table load_test51 into table load_test251 in format RECORDS; the test extracts the data itself

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test252 (a CHAR(10), b CHAR(10), c CHAR(10), PRIMARY KEY(a))
DATAEXTRACT a,b from load_test51 outfile '<infile_path>load_test252_generated.data' RECORDS
DATALOAD TABLE load_test252 A 1 B 2 infile '<infile_path>load_test252_generated.data' RECORDS

Test.Comment: Check various possibilities to specify table names in Loader commands: names contain quotes itself
Test part of loading CCMS data with dbmcli; CNR3TAB and CNR3DATA; see PTS 1132260

Statement.CallString: CREATE TABLE load_test1132260 ( A CHAR(12) ASCII, B CHAR(13) ASCII, C CHAR(10) ASCII, CONSTRAINT LOAD_TEST1132260_PK PRIMARY KEY (A,B))
DATALOAD TABLE load_test1132260 IF POS 23-23 = '|' IGNORE DUPLICATES A 1-12 B 14-22 C 24-32 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test1132260.data' NULL ' ' DATE 'YYYY-MM-DD' TIME 'HH:MM:SS' FORMATTED
DATALOAD TABLE load_test1132260 IF POS 27-27 = '|' IGNORE DUPLICATES A 1-12 B 14-26 C 28-36 INFILE '<infile_path>load_test1132260.data' NULL ' ' DATE 'YYYY-MM-DD' TIME 'HH:MM:SS' FORMATTED
